newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean shipyard union leader arrested.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean shipyard union leader arrested.

text.p: South Korean police arrested on Saturday the union leader of Hyundai Heavy Industries, the country's largest shipyard, a police official said.
"Hyundai Heavy union leader Kim Il-shik was arrested this morning in an apartment," he said by telephone from the southeast city of Ulsan.
Kim's arrest brings to five the number of union leaders picked up since South Korean courts last week issued warrants for the arrest of 20 union leaders.

Seven leaders of the outlawed Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, which has led more than three weeks of strikes in protest at a controversial labour law, are sheltering from arrest at Seoul's Myongdong Cathedral.
Police said Kim was charged with obstructing business.

Earlier this week four union officials from Halla Heavy Industries were arrested on similar charges. State prosecutors have warned the strike leaders they faced arrest unless they dropped industrial action immediately.
